body_html: There's not much more we can do than have heuristics for how we determine the compiler version. So the best way to help is to paste the output of c++ --version or your_compiler --version here so that I can look at it and understand how to make the heuristics more robust. You should also be able to just set the environment variable CXX=g++ before running python setup.py build so that it'll use the g++ binary instead of c++.
body_text: There's not much more we can do than have heuristics for how we determine the compiler version. So the best way to help is to paste the output of c++ --version or your_compiler --version here so that I can look at it and understand how to make the heuristics more robust. You should also be able to just set the environment variable CXX=g++ before running python setup.py build so that it'll use the g++ binary instead of c++.
body: There's not much more we can do than have heuristics for how we determine the compiler version. So the best way to help is to paste the output of `c++ --version` or `your_compiler --version` here so that I can look at it and understand how to make the heuristics more robust. You should also be able to just set the environment variable `CXX=g++` before running `python setup.py build` so that it'll use the `g++` binary instead of `c++`.
